intro: Carmichaelia hollowayi, commonly known as the Cook Strait holly, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often in sandy or rocky soils. It has compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Carmichaelia hollowayi is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
